description: Exploration of the deep blue sea.

slides.title: What is Oceanography?
slides.content:
# The Blue Planet üîµ

Study of the ocean (71% of Earth's surface).
- **Chemical**: Salinity, composition.
- **Physical**: Waves, tides, currents.
- **Biological**: Marine life.
- **Geological**: Seafloor plate tectonics.

slides.title: Ocean Basins
slides.content:
# The 5 Oceans üó∫Ô∏è

1. **Pacific**: Largest and deepest.
2. **Atlantic**: Growing larger.
3. **Indian**: Warmest.
4. **Southern**: Around Antarctica.
5. **Arctic**: Smallest and shallowest.

slides.title: Seawater Properties
slides.content:
# Salty üßÇ

- **Salinity**: ~3.5% (35 parts per thousand). Mostly NaCl.
- **Freezing Point**: -1.9¬∞C (Salt lowers it).
- **Density**: Cold, salty water is heaviest $\to$ Sinks.

slides.title: The Ocean Floor
slides.content:
# Under the Sea ‚õ∞Ô∏è

1. **Continental Shelf**: Shallow extension of land.
2. **Slope/Rise**: Drop off.
3. **Abyssal Plain**: Flat deep floor.
4. **Trenches**: Deepest parts (Mariana Trench 11km deep).
5. **Mid-Ocean Ridge**: Mountain chain where new crust forms.

slides.title: Surface Currents
slides.content:
# Rivers in Sea üåä

Driven by Wind.
- **Gyres**: Giant circular loops.
- **Gulf Stream**: Warm water from Caribbean to Europe (Keeps UK warm).
- Moves heat from equator to poles.

slides.title: Depth Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the deepest feature of the ocean floor?

slides.title: Thermohaline Circulation
slides.content:
# Great Conveyor Belt üè≠

Global deep-water circulation driven by **Density** (Heat & Salt).
- Takes ~1000 years to cycle.
- Regulates Earth's climate.
- Ice melt (fresh water) could stop it.

slides.title: Waves
slides.content:
# Energy Transfer p üëã

Waves move energy, not water.
- **Fetch**: Distance wind blows over water.
- **Swell**: Waves traveled far from storm.
- **Breaking**: Friction with bottom topples the wave.

slides.title: Tides
slides.content:
# Lunar Pull üåï

Rise and fall of sea level caused by Moon (and Sun) gravity.
- **High Tide**: Water pulled toward moon (and opposite side).
- **Spring Tide**: Sun/Moon aligned (Extra high).
- **Neap Tide**: Sun/Moon at 90 deg (Lower high).

slides.title: Marine Life Zones
slides.content:
# Where things live üêü

- **Photic Zone**: Top 200m (Sunlight). Photosynthesis.
- **Aphotic Zone**: Dark deep. Bioluminescence.
- **Benthic**: Bottom dwellers (Crabs).

slides.title: Coral Reefs
slides.content:
# Rainforests of Sea ü™∏

Structures built by coral polyps.
- Home to 25% of marine life.
- **Bleaching**: Stress (heat/acid) makes coral inject algae $\to$ Death.

slides.title: Tide Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which celestial body has the strongest effect on Earth's tides?

slides.title: Hydrothermal Vents
slides.content:
# Black Smokers üö¨

Volcanic vents on seafloor.
- Spew superhot chemical water.
- Life here relies on **Chemosynthesis** (chemical energy), not Sun.
- Tube worms, blind shrimp.

slides.title: Ocean Acidification
slides.content:
# The Other CO2 Problem üçã

Oceans absorb CO2 $\to$ Become acidic ($H_2CO_3$).
- Dissolves shells of clams/corals.
- Threatens entire food web.

slides.title: Tsunamis
slides.content:
# Harbor Waves üåä

Caused by underwater earthquakes or landslides.
- Not tidal waves.
- Move at jet speed (500mph) in open ocean.
- Build massive height when hitting shallow coast.

slides.title: Upwelling
slides.content:
# Nutrients Rises ü•ó

Wind pushes surface water away ‚û°Ô∏è Cold nutrient-rich deep water rises.
- Feeds plankton booms.
- Creates world's best fishing grounds (Peru, California).

slides.title: Plankton
slides.content:
# Drifters ü¶ê

- **Phytoplankton**: Plants. Produce 50% of Earth's oxygen.
- **Zooplankton**: Animals. Eat phyto.
Base of the food chain.

slides.title: Exploring the Deep
slides.content:
# Final Frontier üö¢

We know more about Mars than the deep ocean.
- Uses: Sonar mapping, Submersibles (Alvin), ROVs.
- Enormous pressure makes it difficult.

slides.title: Oceanography Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Oceans drive **Climate** and **Weather**.
- **Currents** circulate heat.
- **Tides** show lunar gravity.
- A vast, vital, and vulnerable resource.
